en: Entrance to American Cemetery in Thiaucourt, France

Gaskell Warren stands at the entry to the St. Mihiel American cemetery in Thiaucourt, France.  St. Mihiel commemorates the death of more than 4,000 American military during World War I. The majority of the casualties buried there were involved in the first American battle in World War I, which was the successful effort to extricate Germans from the French town near Paris.
Era 8 - The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945)
